name: SUEZ
goal:
With a global revenue of €15.3 billion, and 80 990 employees in 2016, SUEZ is a reference player in the environmental market in more than 70 countries.
Our four expertises are water, recycling and waste recovery, water treatment solutions, and consulting.

The Group is active at each stage of the water and waste cycles, and operates both on behalf of public authorities and private sector players. Europe represents 69% of SUEZ's business.

On March 12th 2015 SUEZ accelerated the transformation of its businesses and its organisation by combining all of its activities under a single brand. This single brand, the culmination of over 150 years of shared history, expresses our ambition and demonstrates our commitment to safeguarding resources.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Climate Action, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Development, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enterprise, Environment, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Research and Technology, Taxation
euInitiatives:
SUEZ follows :

- Circular economy package - the Action Plan (REUSE, Plastics Strategy, Waste-to-Energy Communication, Interface, Monitoring framework) and Legislative proposals on Waste Directives (Waste, landfill, Packaging and Packaging Waste, WEEE/Batteries);
- 2020 & 2030 climate & energy packages – The Energy Union and Winter Package (Renewable Energy Directive);
- Evaluation of the EU Drinking Water Directive;
- Proposal for a Regulation on the fertilising products (EC) No 2003/2003;
- Guidelines on the maximization of water reuse in the EU, and the setting of minimum quality requirements for water reuse for agriculture irrigation and aquifer recharge ;
- The Juncker investment plan for Europe;
- Digital single market strategy (smart cities)
